snippet: President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to seek a third term touched off weeks of protests that left dozens of people dead and drove tens of thousands to flee the country.
abstract: Burundi postpones parliamentary and presidential elections amid unrest over Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's decision to seek third term; dozens of people have been killed in protests and tens of thousands have fled the country.

byline.contributor: Sadi Niyungeko contributed reporting from Burundi.

lead_paragraph: President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to seek a third term touched off weeks of protests that left dozens of people dead and drove tens of thousands to flee the country.
